channel.title: EasyRSC inModRoom command

item.title: EasyRSC inModRoom command
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“waj, post:8, topic:522668”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=641165.msg4320675#msg4320675 date=1372179931]

Thanks, i dunno why i couldn’t find it, i searched all the files for inModRoom and nothing was poping up other than commandhandler

Maybe you can help me with my next problem, everytime i add in more than 2 starting items it no longer lets me connect in game when making a new account

my icount
icount=3

my items
i2=70
i1=1263
i0=10

the amount
ia2=1
ia1=1
ia0=1000

EDIT:
NVM i figured it out, had to look inside Player.java to see what i wasnt setting

Thats weird you figured it out because player.java doesnt have anything to do with your starting items

How about you check the load method in the player class, smart ass.

Don’t really need support anymore this is more a question / what peoples opinions are

What would you say the best source is, the source with the most features working yet still a little easy to configure
[/quote]MoparClassic.

A lot don’t know how to get RSCD based servers working, and from what I see there is no tutorial describing how to do so, if they wore I think a lot of people would choose MoparClassic as you recommended.[/quote]The readme says exactly how to do it…

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC inModRoom command
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:7, topic:522668”][quote author=IAmBattousai link=topic=641165.msg4320372#msg4320372 date=1372142421]

Thanks, i dunno why i couldn’t find it, i searched all the files for inModRoom and nothing was poping up other than commandhandler

Maybe you can help me with my next problem, everytime i add in more than 2 starting items it no longer lets me connect in game when making a new account

my icount
icount=3

my items
i2=70
i1=1263
i0=10

the amount
ia2=1
ia1=1
ia0=1000

EDIT:
NVM i figured it out, had to look inside Player.java to see what i wasnt setting

Thats weird you figured it out because player.java doesnt have anything to do with your starting items

How about you check the load method in the player class, smart ass.

Don’t really need support anymore this is more a question / what peoples opinions are

What would you say the best source is, the source with the most features working yet still a little easy to configure
[/quote]MoparClassic.[/quote]
A lot don’t know how to get RSCD based servers working, and from what I see there is no tutorial describing how to do so, if they wore I think a lot of people would choose MoparClassic as you recommended.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC inModRoom command
item.dc:creator: @IAmBattousai IAmBattousai
item.description:
@IAmBattousai wrote:

Is there a way to change the location of the mod room i know you can change the location of where you teleport and stuff

if(!player.getLocation().inModRoom())

I wish to change, rather extend onto the modroom, i have done some custom landscaping added onto the mod room and would like that to be registered as actually in the mod room

Read full topic
